cons: Very challenging,if you got what it takes challenge yourself  it can be rewarding.

title: ‘Best experience to learn customer service.’
pros: Very flexible with work-life balance. Diversity in the workplace. Best way to learn customer service
cons: Customers. Workload can be a bit tedious.

title: ‘A reminder of where I wouldn't like to work.’
pros: Having a discount card and working with my friends. Polite customers were always the best thing about my days working at Woolworths.
cons: Working in the freezer and cold section constantly, resulting in coming to work sick often.

title: ‘Great job! I'd like to work there again.’
pros: There were a lot of good things, the people I worked with were great and very friendly. The different departments I worked in were fun! There are great opportunities toove around the store.
cons: Of course with any job there are challenges. But the biggest I would have to say for myself would be being under the pump with a lot of customers and a lot of work to be done. But it's all worth it.

title: ‘The people part was great but the company (upper management, proceures and policies etc.) was one of the worst I have ever worked for.’
pros: The people I worked with were mostly great and chatting with the regular customers was always good for a laugh and put a smile on both mine and their faces.
cons: Unrealistic job expectations (too much work and not enough time to do it), continuously changing work procedures (many of which were a complete waste of time or made a job more difficult, continuously having my hours cut, getting injured at work and having it still affect me to this day and having my job description changed which dropped me 2 pay levels and then had my hours cut .

title: ‘A great structured company that gives everyone an equal opportunity.’
pros: Very professional company to work for. Very structured and runs smoothly. Opportunity to work in different departments and career development.
cons: Customers are sometimes difficult, in that they are very particular and often dislike supermarket shopping.

title: ‘Friendly team environment in customer service’
pros: The best part was working in a friendly team environment and being able to develop my customer service skills.
cons: The main challenge was having to deal with difficult customers which would complain about matters that were out of my control.

title: ‘Despite the narrow time frames, it's always a pleasure working at Woolworths’
pros: Fantastic camaraderie, great to work with, friendly, helpful. LOADS of help and advice.
cons: Trying to keep up to date with Head Office amendments - they don't always work well on the shop floor. Sometimes not enough hours to go around. Time management is often a REAL challenge!

title: ‘My experience has been average, it would be better if they could give me better contracted hours as I'm no longer at school’
pros:
Learning new things 
Discounts
cons: Getting more hours or contract hours

title: ‘Overall it is a great place to work. Salary is decent and most of the time a fairly stress free environment.’
pros: Very supportive and caring environment. Perks of having a staff discount card that can be used at multiple stores, including woolworths petrol stations. Flexibility and great work/ life balance.
cons: Can be extremely physical at times. Required to stand for long periods of time.

title: ‘Great place to learn new skills and develop within the retail career.’
pros:
The good things are that the staff I have are wonderful people. There are some truly great team members to work with.
The company policies are good but can be maintained a little better.
Pay is fair and always on time.
cons:
Some challenges are that the time given to certain tasks can be very challenging while trying to maintain the quality of the company's standard.
Tough to have a good work/life balance in a managers position.

title: ‘The great friends i made with staff and Management, meant the work went quicker and fun.’
pros: For me it was the relationships I developed with Management, after I had been at Woolworths for a year I decided to go back to study my manager was very co-operative infitting my studies in with what days and hours I could work so I basically picked my own hours which was great especially on the weekend when pay their is huge.
cons: Working with volitile customers who can be aggressive, I learnt a lot about communication skills and how to talk customers down and relax them to keep the shop a safe place for everyone, that to me was really important.

title: ‘Good start for a career, but get out while you're young!’
pros:
Salary packages for team leaders & store managers are market competitive, but don't expect anything fantastic as an average team member.

As with all large companies moral very much depends on what store you are at.

Woolwotths was once a powerhouse for traing gun retailers but the current down turn has led to cuts.
cons: If you're on salary - you are expected to work a 50hr week minimum(five 10hr shifts) more in peak periods.

title: ‘Its good if you get your head down and just do what is required of you, management wont respect you if you mess up, even once.’
pros: Its a good team environement
cons: Equality, Respect. Its hard to get recognition for your work. Roster flexibility is also a challenege

title: ‘Good first job, don't make it a career.’
pros: Make good friends and get to meet lots of different people. always opportunities to develop and move up in the company
cons: Many managers I worked under did not support the staff. The company makes decisions that will best suit stock holders and not look after the needs of the staff. They take \"the customer is always right\" motto to extremes and allow customers to yell and scream at staff members and even throw items at staff and then management will apologise to the customer for the inconvenience and send them a voucher and staff will be reprimanded for their actions.

title: ‘It’s not as good as I would ever have through it to be as management is very too down and rude ’
pros: The pay is pretty good and get to talk to a lot of people
cons: Rude management, dirty work environment, physically painful as I always have a sore back and rude customers

title: ‘I fully enjoyed working at the company it was fun and fulfilling’
pros: Skill development, fun work environment, physically challenging, work with children.
cons: Working with children, demands full attention, hard work, continuous self training
location: Newcastle CBD, New South Wales, Australia

title: ‘Five Years Worth’
pros: The people I work with are very friendly, the tasks and duties are fun to take part in, and I enjoy helping the customers find what they require.
cons: Finding a specific product that a customer wants that is outside of my department; sometimes it takes a while to find an item because I work mainly around the lunch hour period for the managers and supervisors.

title: ‘It's a job.’
pros: I like that I go to work do my job and then come home no stress or after hours worries. I take school holidays off without pay to be with my kids and they accommodate me so I can do this. You get to know the regular customers and can have a good relationship with them.
cons: To do the same mundane job day after day. Management are forever changing and they don't introduce themselves and often won't even acknowledge you with a hello.

title: ‘Great company with great people.’
pros: Great people to work with and always opportunities for career progression. Good opportunity for a first job.
cons: Not always easy to transfer stores when relocating.

title: ‘Working at woolworth gives you the opportunity to learn and grow as an individual’
pros: Working with people with diverse background. Getting to meet different people everyday. Friendly and nurturing environment to work in.
cons: Meeting different people everyday means you may have to deal with difficult people on a regular basis.

title: ‘Working for Woolworths is thoroughly unrewarding’
pros: Lots of break times compared to other places.
cons:
Oh the challenges..... 
Putting up with the general public day in, day out. The customers are rude and don't even have the decency to use common manners. 
I can confidently say that not one person in the store I was at enjoyed their job.
Not to mention the multi-million dollar company can only afford to give their staff a 5% discount.

title: ‘Fantastic place to work, especially for a first job.’
pros: The people are all great to work with, there's a lot of room for development and the hours are good and flexible with other commitments such as school and uni. Learned so many valuable and transferable skills that have been very beneficial in other jobs.
cons: Job can get repetitive and boring especially when its quiet and nothing to do.

title: ‘ Great ’
pros: Good work life balance good whilst at uni/ school although massive growth for career opportunity and development
cons:
Working under pressure
Customers can be annoying

title: ‘Wouldn’t work here again’
pros:
-You get to meet different customers everyday.
- Other employees are nice and easy to get along with.
cons:
- Not enough hours per week. 
- Management at this store was inexperienced in the role, and extremely rude. 
- Always have to be up to go to work even if they call half an hour before they want you too start.
- Can be very boring especially on front end.

title: ‘Good place to work, people are fine and its a great compnay to work for as it teaches you your valuble job skills.’
pros: Love the management team, makes the workplace a smooth environment.
cons: Working with people who you don't necessarily get along with and trying to balance life and work when you get rostered on for shifts that you don't know about and or don't usually work.

title: ‘Excellent workplace for a first time job or even for someone looking for part time work if they have other responsibilities.’
pros: The shifts always worked around what you had on outside of work, if you were studying or had extra curricular activities. The people you work with are always willing to help you and are great to get along with.
cons: Learning where everything was in the store.

title: ‘Was a good first job.’
pros: The people can help to make working fun. The company have good views when it comes to customers and making sure they are happy,  and this is something most employees strive to do.
cons: Hard to move up in the rank, such as management or supervisor.  I feel they need to teach the current managers how to talk to the everyday workers.

title: ‘Was good as a first job while in school for a bit of extra cash, no good as a career as full time work or career progression were not available’
pros: Team benefits (discount and points) are really good
cons: No opportunity for career growth or work stability

title: ‘Flexible. Friendly. First Choice.’
pros: Best staff team, you make so many friends on top of the customers and just feel supported by another family.
cons: Like any retail job, time management and working efficiently are a must especially during our busiest times.

title: ‘It’s the best working environment, get opportunities to do different jobs around the store & easy to adjust to.’
pros: Great people to work with, new updated look is so much easier and appealing to work in
cons: Minimum 5 hour shifts, low pay, weekend hours only

title: ‘A more or less easy and fun job that is made into a high pressure, anxiety inducing job, by management.’
pros: Work colleagues on the same level as you are often good to work with, that is, other people who are employed in the same job position. Customers are also usually pretty friendly so it's not a bad place to work in terms of most of the company.
cons: Tiring work for your body at the checkout. Very demanding on your feet and back as you have to stand for lengthy amounts of time with only small breaks on shorter shifts. Managers can be very cruel and put far too much pressure on workers instead of being kind and understanding human beings.

title: ‘A fast paced, team friendly and learning and skill orientated career.’
pros: A great rewarding company where you get paid and treated above and beyond for your hard work. A great working environment and a fantastic team culture, I feel excited knowing I work at Woolworths.
cons: A work life balance and essentially being one of the busiest businesses in Australia all year round. Different managers have different ways of doing things and making everyone happy can be tough.

title: ‘Fair pay for repetitive tasks with no future career prospects. ’
pros: Good pay, management are nice enough. You will work the hours you are rostered on for, you generally don't need to stay back for anything.
cons: No room for career progression, only those who the manager favours are offered such opportunities. Boring, repetitive work.

title: ‘Excellent working experience ’
pros: Friendly work culture
cons: Time management and working with less time for break

title: ‘Great place to start for your first time for a job, requires a lot of energy so youths or early 20s are suited.’
pros:
Quick to learn 
Great working environment 
Great team members and managers who are friendly and give a helping hand when needed!
cons:
Time management
Completing tasks on time
Customer service (items or ingredients that I have never heard of)

title: ‘Great experience but very exhausting.’
pros: Great experience for retail experience, can progress in the ranks easily if you have the initiative and the will power for it.
cons: There is not much support for any staff member, and there are quite alot of unreliable people around which makes your job much harder and you are expected to do their job as well during the same time.

title: ‘Some great people, some not so.’
pros: Variety of different roles to try. Good formalised procedures and safety systems.
cons: Particular sites don't have very good culture,   both management and floor morale. Sours the experience. Political games overshadow genuine initiative and enthusiasm. Little to no loyalty at some sites.

title: ‘My experience working for woolworths wasn't so great, i felt pushed by the managers a lot and all i was doing was trying my best, team members and supervisors were great though.’
pros: You build really good friendships with most of the people you work with.
cons: Keeping on top of everything all the time whilst having a sore back was a big challenge for me

title: ‘Great experience but whats next for the future?’
pros: Woolies let's you gain the best in all departments. I started working just as a after school casual and now I work full time as a manager. They are so open for opportunities for everyone and they want you to gain an experience in all departments
cons: In the department I work in, making sure my online orders are completed on time or I could run short of time and not have them done to 100% satisfaction!

title: ‘Overall, there are talented professional people & passionate people to work with.’
pros: There are opportunities for advancement if you worthy or fit in outside of work life, not based on your capability to do the job.
cons: Pressures from management, and given extra work if you're not in their fit ,ie looks, social with them outside of work, or too passionate (outspoken)/lack of it, and a threat you may succeed them.

title: ‘The workplace is a healthy and amazing environment for any employee to work in.’
pros: The work, the people and also how things are supposed to be done. The way it should be done is the best and enjoyable way.
cons: The things i haven't been trained to do yet. Such as using the slicers, taking the slicer apart and rebuilding the slicer. Taking care of the food products, etc.

title: ‘Easy job if your just a team member but hard work if you are a 2IC or department manager’
pros:
Flexibility with rostering.
Some of the co-workers.
cons:
Working with store managers and department managers who have been with the company for decades but haven't adapted to new processes and technologies.
Authoritarian management styles.
High workload with low pay.
No help with moving up the ranks or help getting a role in head office.
Lazy department managers.
When area mangers came to visit everyone panicked.

title: ‘Different and enjoyable.’
pros: Great people to work with, friendly customers, being able to help people in the community, always learning and great social environment.
cons: Difficult and rude customers.

title: ‘Safe employment but they have high expectations of employees to do overtime with out pay. ’
pros: Very unionised so job is very safe.
cons: To much politics in stores and workloads are to high. There are haras... Ment issues in store's.

title: ‘I enjoyed my time with Woolworths. I miss many of my team members and my regular customers which I developed friendships with and watched them grow over my 11 years working for the company.’
job_title: Customer Service, Bakery Assistant, Long Life Team Member, Replenishment Team Member, Store Ofdering.
pros: Team members, regular customers, keeping busy with work.
cons: Working for one department and having to assist in other departments but still trying to get my jobs done.

title: ‘Not the best place to work’
pros: Get to meet and work with people
cons: Unrealistic expectations on employees,Work life balance,Poor training,Career advancement (you have to be in the circle) No support for employees,Poor communication to lower level employees .Salary would be good if you dint have to work excessive hours to complete your task.

title: ‘Working with Woolworths was average over all and provided stability and experience while at school, after graduating there’s not much room for improvement’
pros: Great colleagues and flexibility in hours worked
cons: The only rostering and leave system and pay system

title: ‘An amazing way to boost skills in retail that can help you carry yourself to other workplaces.’
pros: Great opportunities to learn and a great way to learn retail and customer service. Great way to learn how to talk.
cons: Not knowing everybody who worked there. However this was partly my fault as my contract dictated that I worked only on Tuesday's and Wensdays at night.

title: ‘Some of the best years of my life’
pros: The money was great and there is plenty of opportunities to move forward and step up in your career if that's the career you decide. They are always flexible with rosters can always work around uni or school or other jobs.
cons: I never really any challenges in my career with Woolworths however customers can be a little tough but as long as you smile and are happy and nice they are usually fine.

title: ‘Woolworths stole my life.’
pros: Most of the low level staff (ie not management) are lovely to work with. The work is alright as long as you don't let anyone push you around. And don't stay for to long.
cons: There is no communication between staff. Little to no guidance when it comes to doing a new job or task. Little to no help from management. Store it just a mess all the time. No consideration for staff. Their only focus is money.

title: ‘Enjoyed working in the meat dept  for 13 years until l got moved due injury on my back and suffered ever since working in grocery dept’
pros: L learnt a lot from diff people in diff dept's enjoyed  working with the friends l made
cons: Completing planograms tickets and other various jobs that was given to me

title: ‘Eye opening’
pros: Occasional team environment, easy work, good coworkers, good pay, did make some good friends, working in the self serve area, learning new things about the self serve checkouts, being trusted enough to be left in charge for the day
cons: The regular customers, the department managers, departments fighting over me, some of the tasks we were told to do, being forced to sell raffle tickets and other promotional products like the aussie animal cards

title: ‘Great workplace for people of all ages and skills’
pros: The job role is rather easy. I get on with majority of my teammates. The manager is good at their job and treats workers with respect.
cons: Based on the location of my job, a large amount of the customers are mentally ill and it is difficult dealing with such personalities.

title: ‘Fine if you dont mind following people with fixed mind sets regarding everything’
job_title: BWS Liquor, Homeshop, Nightfill, Dayfill. Alrounder
pros: Pay was reasonable, hours were initially ok
cons: Backward thinking, petty individuals in management positions, rude and somewhat threatening/lack of understanding regarding University exam times, ie we don't care that you have exams we want you to work regardless.

title: ‘I loved going to work and it was a good environment to work in.’
pros: Other staffs was really nice and was always willing to help me in whatever area I needed help in.
cons: Their was always customers that would stuff up your day but you Learn to get over them little things.

title: ‘Although i learnt so much and developed in every area of my management role, only thru my own initiative and drive, with no support from senior management..’
pros: Some of my work colleagues were like family..
cons:
Management
Duty of care
Wage budget compared to expectations..

title: ‘A lot of opportunities if you are willing to sacrifice a work life balance ’
pros: Good salary until you breakdown for how many hours you are required to work
cons: Very little understanding on day to day operations from upper management

title: ‘Working in my role as a stocktake assistant is rewarding every day I do it as I meet customers fellow staff members and no matter how bad your home life is these people always bring the positive out in you. They are my work family.’
pros: The people I meet no matter what branch we work at provide a friendly and positive environment to work in which makes our job fun and for filling
cons: There are really no challenges in our line of work but if I had to chose one it would be, try your hardest to be the best you can be

title: ‘Couldnt say i would want to work with the comoany again’
job_title: Many Rolls In The Grocery Field
pros: Honestly say it was a good place to work back in the late 90's but due to changes lack of staff and bad management i wouldnt recommend it to the younger ones
cons: Bad management in most stores, care factor for their staff zero

title: ‘Bad, don't work for Woolworths Keperra’
pros: People were nice. Isn't really much else to say that is positive.
cons: We didn't have a manager for 2 months, no more training was provided after first day. No chance for career progression as new managers were hired from elsewhere. Got in trouble for going to the bathroom. Only was given 5 hours per week after being told I would be receiving 25-30. Work was long and exhausting. Managers strict about breaks.

title: ‘Great place to work’
pros: Good working environment (if the customers are friendly), great flexibility around uni and personal commitments. The team are always helpful and so long as you are respectful and punctual you are looked after and valued.
cons: Dealing with customers can be difficult or unfriendly, working as a casual who is older than 18 means shifts can sometimes be hard to come by.

title: ‘It was a good start to my work career but there are things that need to be improved and I would rate working at woolworths 5/10’
pros: My colleagues were very friendly and it was easy to talk to them. Working as a team was a good experience for me
cons: Some equipment is old and not working properly, management is very unorganised and demands unrealistic expectations (I was working for 2 people)

title: ‘Good pay, Good hours, Great mates, and easy to understand job description’
pros: Good Pay,  Straight forward job description, suitable hours if you are a morning or afternoon person. Always have someone to talk to. Benefits are good as well.
cons: Repetitive work,  can be boring if you crave stimulation,  some heavy lifting required. lack of movement in the food chain if you start at ground zero and as a casual

title: ‘Great opportunities and experience worth having on your resume. Manager quality can be variable so do your research and join one of the genuine high performing teams.’
pros: Great opportunity to gain breadth of experience and fast paced environment. Committed to doing the right thing for employees in terms of career development and engagement.
cons: Silo organisation so difficult to get cross functional traction. Some leaders more concerned about 'being right' than 'doing the right thing'

title: ‘Woolworths is a great start but I recommend that you don't stay long.’
pros: A multitude of different tasks are available for each employee from assisting with the frontend to preparing fresh deli or seafood items or working in Produce.
cons: Management can be tricky at the best of times. My advice would to not let them get to you, think before you do and work hard but don't ge a robot. Management will use and abuse you if you let them!

title: ‘Career for life.’
pros: Great salary, career advancement & opportunity.
cons: High pressure for sales growth & profit.  Easy to get burnt out. Need to be switched on 24/7.  Need to use own initiative and marketing skills to chase sales, very hands on and getting to know your customers is a must.

title: ‘Superiors to short fused in need of change to long in the one area’
pros: Work in general having responsibilities, dealings with public on day to day basics.
cons: Learning & growing knowledge

title: ‘I Made alot of great friends and learnt alot about retail .’
pros: Working with nice people in a good environment. Being part of the Woolworths Team. Good employers
cons: Dealing with the public. People can be so rude to you because they think you are just a checkout person. They don't realise there is more to that in a supermarket

title: ‘Overall the job has satisfied my to some extent financially but I wouldn't choose it as a career as there's less chances of career development and advancement.’
pros: Flexible working hours,Woolworths provides people without any working experience an opportunity to gain that experience. Being one of the giant retailers, it adds as a great reference to CVs.
cons: Poor management, new recruits must be given proper training to develop more confidence in their roles, break and meal times should not be compromised. Communication between staff and management can be improved by having regular team meetings for opinions and discussions.

title: ‘Hard but rewarding work’

cons: Hours, labour, coworkers.

title: ‘A long journey.’

cons: Working at woolworhts presesnted many challenges each very different to the next.

title: ‘Challenging’
pros: Majority of the staff get to be like family
cons: I don't get the chance to progress

title: ‘\"Smash it out!\" - Chris Ellis, Nightfill Manager’
pros:
One of the best things about working for Woolworths Ltd was being able to meet many new people, customers and co-workers alike. Making great relationships made a comfy environment to work in. 
For the tasks I needed to do, I'd say the pay was above average. It really is well paying for an after school job or young adult that covers the basics and then some, as long as you got hours.
Being with the SDA union was also a great positive. There were many benifets included that helped me work for as long as I did.
cons: First of all: the Woolworths Radio. Kinda drove me a bit crazy hearing the same 8 songs everyday... Along with the same tasks being performed at work made each day blend into one another and feel exactly the same. If it wasn't for my coworkers keeping things interesting, I'd never keep track of what day it was.

title: ‘Great place to work if you enjoy team work’
pros: Great mix of people, and all were helpful and friendly.
cons: I'm not a morning person, so waking at 3:45am each day to arrive ready to work at 5am was quite a strain, but the day greatly improved once I arrived, as the team made it feel like you were achieving real results each day, which meant everyone worked together to make it possible.

title: ‘I'd rather pick up dog s##t.’
pros: Most of the people I work with, we get along well and try to work hard for each other.
cons: The hours (night fill); unrealistic expectations on work goals from management; constant cost cutting and never providing enough hours to get the job done, the just expect it done anyway; always expected to bend over backwards for the company but they never want to make adjustments to help you out;  security measures and staff protection is atrocious; they're only worried about safety issues when it suits them; poor wages; get stuck working nights for many years and get told you can leave if you ever ask for day work; all they're worried about is profit.

title: ‘My first job lasted 10 years! Fantastic experience!’
job_title: Front-end Cashier, Liquor Assistant, Night Fill, Perishables
pros: The pay, training, and flexibility in working hours. I payed my way through high school, university, and travel, while working in various departments on a casual basis. I was offered career progression, and trusted with training new staff, opening and closing the store, and ordering stock. I made life-long friends, and had accommodating and encouraging department managers.
cons: Regional managers have unrealistic expectations and talk down to department managers.

title: ‘Great after school/ weekend job.’
pros:
Flexible hours, always work, easy to take leave.
Great team environment, always paid on time
cons: Low pay rates, managers can be rude to staff, company is not open to staff moving departments within the store.

title: ‘My experience here is to try and put away the bad attitude and do the right thing for my only safety and respect each other.’
pros: People is so friendly and moving around much and also getting to know all directions in the area.
cons: What i know working in the company is bad languages, and sometimes people have rude attitude, no respect of other property like just take anything that doesn't belong to them.

title: ‘I would recommend woolworths as a great place to work’
pros: Working with people who can work as a team my hours fit in with my lifestyle staff are friendly easy access to food job security
cons: Getting the job done in the required time and staff who don't always work to there ability

title: ‘I love customers’
pros:
The interaction with customers from all walks of life is the best of woolworths. if you like chatting and able to listen, it helps you to do the best in shop for returning customers and they trust you. they will always come back to see you. that's the best part is when they come not for the product but the person who smiled at them, who shared a great meal idea or some 
one just to talk to . that is enjoyment I get.
cons: Completion from other supermarket chains, the pricing and availability of products. cost of doing business,

title: ‘Futhering your career and getting great customer service skills’
pros: Help futher your carrers and help you with any situations you need help with
cons: Working around different people and being able to communicate properly with difficult questions customers ask you

title: ‘I had worked in supermarkets for over 10 years. Watched ridiculous people get promotions. Worked a huge amount ove overtime for nothing. Wasnt treated with respect. Felt used and abused. Will never go back to supermarkets’
pros: Job security
cons: Cost cutting. Unrealistic budgets. No support.

title: ‘Woolworths doesn't care about their staff.’
pros: The pay rates are average. It is very hard to get fired. Lazy staff can get away with a lot.
cons: Safety standards are ignored. If you are not lazy all the work gets dumped on your shoulders. Hours are always being cut and expectations are always rising. Training is always just a set of Chinese whispers so you can never tell if you are doing the right thing.

title: ‘Very challenging yet rewarding and growth based experience’
pros: Skill development, people development, the chance to learn and grow and successful be the top of your field with such a huge retailer.
cons: Fast paced retail, teams of 50 plus. Customer service needs to be high because of 1000s of customers through the door.

title: ‘A great company that has been successful despite its weaknesses , will be successful again and it's just whether you want to hang in for the ride’
pros: Great working environment, with good facilities , lots of upside once the company gets back on track
cons: Lack of leadership and strategy, internal appointments are not always managed transparently

title: ‘A good first or last job ’
pros:
Good work. Great work if you love customer service like I do & having a good ol' chat with the locals. 

You can choose to move to your preferred department within the grocery stores if there are positions available ie. Bakery, deli, front end (you can even work some time in multiple departments), as well as transfers to other Woolworths locations if needed.
cons:
Can be stressful for those in supervising or management positions, but as a cashier of Woolworths there is no stress - just reasonable expectation of appearance, attitude, and responsibility. 

I started in Woolworths young and didn't know how career development in the store worked so I missed out on learning some things in the earlier stages of my employment. 

Can get slow and boring as a cashier because there are only so many duties you can do to maintain the store and keep busy when there aren't a lot of customers. 

After years of working on registers I have developed low level RSI in my right hand and arm from using the touch screen.

title: ‘Working at Woolworths is great because you're in a team environment, it's never the same each day and there are many opportunities for career development.’
pros: Working in a team environment.
cons: Challenging customers.

title: ‘Good when the hours are there’
pros: Good rate of pay, if work is actually steady (it rarely is)
cons: Getting through the first 6 months to get on the books, when before you do, you get sent home when its not busy (a lot)

title: ‘Very flexible and custom to your study/school life. Good pay for the type of work you do.’
pros:
The good things.
Flexible, good pay, any types of hours you want to work, so many departments to choose from, good friends to make, good store manager. Good breaks for every shift you work
cons: No meetings, not the highest safety awareness culture but still ok. Not much communication between different groups/departments

title: ‘It is ejoyable’
pros: Team work everybody work as a collective to achieve a common goal .Communication was the key ,and the ability to have a laugh .
cons: Being consistent .Always reintegrate policy .Enjoy the work and always follow up . To communicate what you need and when .Working in the cold.

title: ‘Its a great place to work  but i am now interested in taking  some different environment such as office role.’
pros: Management always looking after their staffs.Specially my manager always giving me so many windows to keep my work life balance.
cons: Every day is challenging. if you keep your standard at a certain level then you can win all the time.

title: ‘A total pleasure to work for.’
pros: Staff relationships, opportunities of advancement, great working environment.
cons: None really. learning new procedures sometimes came with their own challenges.

title: ‘It gets you by, but is by no means a dream job.’
pros: Its a job, it gets you by, you make friends.
cons: It can become uncomfortable if you're doing a lot of physical work, unbearably so. But it's work, you push through. I have never felt comfortable to express my discomfort however.

title: ‘A pleasant experience with a good solid company that opens up a variety of opportunities.’
pros: It was a good experience that could lead to further development in other areas.  I really enjoyed the customer interaction.
cons: Trying to be accepted by people that have worked there for a very long time

title: ‘A good first time job and casual job.’
pros:
A pretty good working environment, everyone is pretty nice and easy to get along with (staff and customers). 
Flexible with availability hours.
cons:
Not enough staff, so it can get busy and stressful.
It's hard to move out of a department once you've been in one for a while. But it can happen.

title: ‘Working as a check out Operator’
pros: The opportunities that working in a place like Woolworths can give you, the friendly environment that is around you and knowing that you are supporting Australian farmers and knowing we are doing something to help our local community's.
cons: I seem to see the hard thing is trying to get along with every single customer as this can be a very hard and challenging thing to do but at the end of the day if there was no customers there would be no business so that how I see if they are coming to spend there hard earned money at this company so we have to give them the best service we can.

title: ‘Disappointing’
pros:
The team are brilliant but lower management is criticised constantly over management style.
Lack of mentorship.
Good for university and high school students provided they have no long term goals within the business.
cons:
Never ever enough staff/hours to adequately do the job required.
Underperforming staff moved to other departments, which reduces hours for others.
Very limited opportunity for promotion or permanent.
Some management have little experience in departments they run.

title: ‘Life saver.’
pros: Woolworth DC Brisbane was the best ever. State of the ark of everything.  Hours were awsome you just apply for the hours that was suitable to family life. When i was there it was a 12hr shift i had all sorts of Starting time to Monday to Sunday from early start, midday starts, afternoon, night & graveyard shift. Late afternoon was my shift which helped so much with family responsibilities. Sunday shift was a life saver.
cons: Getting use to the 12hr shift

title: ‘Experience is amazing, i have learnt alot from Woolworths, regarding sales and time management.’
pros: Great work place, ton of experience with sales etc if you are interested in management rolls.
cons: There isnt much challenges, apart from making sure everything gets finished on time, and that the hand over is good for the next member in.

title: ‘Work only if u don’t have any other surving option or be ready for back pain and to be more tolerant against customer and higher level staff.’
pros: Working in supermarkets is obviously safer than warehouse and peril station because of location.
cons:
Nightfill is nightmares to work with...they will give u extremely tight time to unload groceries and fill shalves...if u can’t make it no excuses....supervisor and mangers are hard to del with...

On customer counter , it’s very fast paced environment...15mins break mins at 15 min u have to back on counter no matter how far is lunch room or toilets are.
They will fore u to work in Deli even though u don’t want to.
Online shopping is good but again u can’t get away with working in freezer and chiller where working temp is -20deg C.

title: ‘A good job you can balance with your personal interests.’
pros: It’s a good job, not my dream job, but good. You can switch off as soon as you finish your shift. Pays the bills
cons: Some customers treat you like garbage. The communication from management downwards is not very good and as a basic worker you are usually out of the loop.

title: ‘Good with but with its challengers’
pros: Big company with lots of opportunities to more within differ area.
cons: Upper management alittle out of touch with how many much is should cost to run a site and to fast to cut cost and labour being the easy cost to cut.

title: ‘I loved working at Woolworths and would work there again’
pros: Security, cleanliness, opportunities, hours, variety
cons: Difficult customers, management being too busy to teach procedures thoroughly

title: ‘Great introduction to retail manufacturing’
pros: Flexibility on hours i was there for 10 years and due to various reasons eg: school etc i signed about 4 different part time contracts.
cons: To utilise the hours given and maximise efficiency in terms of output as working in bakery dept changes from full production to a warm spot and lack of direction from management

title: ‘Terrible work place, stay away’
pros: Have been working with the company for 20 years and can honestly say I have nothing good to comment about the place
cons: Badly unstaffed, treat people like a number and they expect a person on a normal wage to do the same amount of work as a manager for a lot less money. Also if you're applying for a job they seem to only put people on for 4-5 hour shifts and they no longer put people on full time

title: ‘Great career opportunities but be prepared to work hard for it’
pros: Definitely career progression if you have the right attitude and want. Great in store team environment
cons: Above store level management, very detached and limited understanding of pressures in store, very demanding. No work life balance at store level

title: ‘As a normal employees yes il recommend but as a manager then its a no no!!’
pros: Good incentive n when u have a good store manager then its real good but when u have a bad store manager that does not have any experience in store level then it get really bad!!
cons: As a manager we face employees budget cut every year. The more you make the more the department hours get cut and that cames to bad store manger and area manager and higher management.

title: ‘Working at woolworths was a good experience that i hope to one day be able to do again.’
pros: Working at woolworths is a good opportunity to develop good communication skills and make good friends.
cons: Dealing with unhappy customers is definitely a struggle but its apart of the job.

title: ‘Unhappy’
pros: The pay and the flexibility for people who are studying or working somewhere else.
cons: Your body will start to ache and eventually there will be permanent damage, management will try and fire you before you go up in pay grade and everyone sells each other out in Eba negotiations.

title: ‘Don't work here.’
pros: Good people around you, 5% staff discount across multiple stores because they're all owned by the same parent company,
cons: Loads of angry and abusive customers that we just don't get paid enough to deal with, management at store level is rubbish, complaints to management higher than those at store level are laughed off, action is never taken on the \"all-ears\" survey (basically a survey they send to every staff member in Australia to apparently try to improve the working experience). I've wanted to quit so many times because it's so stressful and I know no matter how many times I complain I'm never going to be heard. It's like every manager has to be better than all the others so its a very unsettled environment and really uncomfortable to work in. I actually warn people away from working here and it's just overall a really really bad place to work.

title: ‘Started as an apprentice, now assistant manager of bws liquor (woolworths liquor group).’
pros: Being apart of a family is being an employee at woolworths all staff members get along well and hey the pay isnt to bad either
cons: Working your way up to promotions can be challenging if you are not hungry to succeed  but woolworths has all the training necessary to advance you career

title: ‘What a great working culture and well supported by manager who care.’
pros: Well structured and managed company. Great leadership and diversity within one organisation with plenty of career opportunities in a diverse range of aeras
cons: Managing a large group of staff from various cultures was a huge challenge and a great learning curve.

title: ‘Why work here it’s bad’
pros: You would quite often have food in the staff room and meeting new people
cons: I was a casual and a reliable one at that so I would work 6 or 7 days with one day off so I was constantly tired and customers even thought I lived there

title: ‘We are extremely over worked and the family/work balance is not existant.’
pros: Some of the people there understand the stresses of working for the company making it more enjoyable and easier to handle.
cons: A lot of promotions are based on who you know. The recent wage cuts have people doing 3 or 4 peoples jobs at once making it stressful. Most managers do 13 to 14 hour days making having a family life hard.

title: ‘A great job for a good time not a long time’
pros: A great job whether you're in high school or at university because of the flexibility in hours due to the widespread trading hours.
cons:
Having to deal with technological faults eg. Machines not working on a regular basis.

Higher management not in touch with the issues staff face on a day to day basis.

Continuous cost cutting yet demand for better performances

title: ‘Ok, but frustrating’
pros: Working along side good people, who work hard, and always did what needed to be done.
cons:
Dealing with constant change of management(on a yearly bases). 
watching other hard working employees (who have been employed by Woolworths for more than 10yrs) not have the opportunity to advance, no equality no diversity.

title: ‘Working at Woolworths was a great step towards my career goals’
pros: Intersecting with many people of different perspectives, enjoying working with people I liked, working hard and receiving appropriate and equal benefits.
cons: Balancing work in different departments of the store and social life/ other commitments. Some work related injuries.

title: ‘Again diversity and the age groups make it a great place to work’
pros: My role offers diversity so that keeps it interesting. I have always worked with groups and that makes it fun, working with a variety of ages and people can be a challenge but it seems to be working ok
cons: Unfortunately people are people, and when it doesn't always go their way they often make fools of themselves. They end up just thinking about themselves and that is sad to watch because most of the time they don't realise it

title: ‘Woolworths is a job you need, not a career to start.’
pros: The greatest thing about Woolworths is the team culture. While management tends to ignore the humanity of the team, the individual members make every day better.
cons: Woolworths is a very limiting company. Quite often those who voluntarily choose to step down from positions of leadership are ignored and overlooked for leadership roles in the future.

title: ‘Excellent first job that teaches you lifelong work lessons.’
pros: Good work force. Good casual pay. Excellent environment. Useful skills for further career opportunities.
cons: You have to get used to weekend work if your are not used to it.

title: ‘Customer service’
pros:
Career advancement, friendly staff.
Taking pride in your approach to staff, customers, and work
cons: Being on your feet for long periods, finding stock in freezer department . Putting on juniors over mature people, and they didn’t turn up for work...paid peanuts you get monkeys as the saying goes.

title: ‘Work in a supermarket often gets a bad reputation, I found my time here to be neither good nor bad, and I would return to the position if necessary.’
pros: Tedious work, but there were no sales targets and the work is routine and straightforward. Not the best place in the world to work but if you can secure a part time position it is guaranteed hours and they can be quite flexible. As with any job, I found the teams of people you work with can make or break it, but for the most part, it is an okay job.
cons: Working in a supermarket means you face a diverse range of customers, some of whom will look down upon people in the cashier role and not treat them very well. This was difficult to manage at some points. Also, middle management changed frequently, and each new manager had a different approach to running things, this was difficult to keep up with at some points, especially when large changes were implemented and then scrapped. Also, high incidences of being understaffed, whether due to budget or just low on staff members, this made the work stressful at times.

title: ‘Could be good with the right management’
pros:
Some of the people were really fun to work with.
Gave me good experience in working in deli and a high stress environment during holiday periods.
cons:
Management were rude and unsupportive. Too many people trying to be boss.
Management did not like that I was still at high school and made it known they wanted me to leave.

title: ‘Good if you're wanting a forgettable part-time job. If you want to climb the ranks however, you'll have to deal with a lot of people who shouldn't be in positions of power - best to take the experience and move on to another workplace’
pros:
- The people you work with are great, you can make a lot of good friends
- Flexible contracts with study
- Great first job, menial but room for personal development
- Professional development if you seek it
cons:
- Terrible managers, both department and store; usually the lowest common denominators in life. Poor leadership and decision-making, will crush morale for KPIs.
- Customer entitlement is high, but made even worse with 'whinge hard enough and we'll give you what you want' procedures that are numerous within every service-based department.

title: ‘Great, Satisfied & would reapply for work in future’
pros:
Great people to work with, great structure of a work place, very well managed
Work load was divided between roles
cons:
Unsatisfied customers with products.
The cool rooms in winter.
Busy peaks and people having bad days.

title: ‘I would never recommend Woolworths as a company to progress in. ’
pros: Work colleagues, I’ve met some great people working there.
cons: Working as an assistant manager and being expected to do all the things a salaried manager would do but for half the money. Never feeling respected, and having to reapply for a position you worked in for years because of a new “restructure”

title: ‘An employer who currently doesn't care for anything but the bottom line’
pros: Job security, variety of hours & positions instore, no day is ever the same
cons: Incredibly bad staff management & a negative environment to work in. Must be a people person!

title: ‘I loved working with my Woolworths family!’
pros: There are so many opportunities with many different departments, if you decide you are getting bored then you can easily ask for a change of department or if you are looking for more hours there is always the opportunity to work in more than one
cons: The challenge that I found was that in my time there, there were many changes in management.

title: ‘Working at Woolworths was the typical first job, easy to obtain, easy to actually work at, but little opportunity for development and low pay.’
pros: Flexible hours, nice workers, relatively easy work.
cons: Not a very high salary, not that much room to move up in the company considering there are such copious numbers of employees.

title: ‘Enjoyable , challenging and diverse’
pros: Constantly changing environment , interaction with customers and meeting their expectations. No two days are alike
cons: As a Store Manager, keeping abreast of day to day operations of managing a successful supermarket  to ensure we are meeting our customers overall shopping experience
location: Queensland, Australia and New South Wales

title: ‘Good place to start as a student and can learn management or can built a career ’
pros: Get learn as you work. Flexible hours and suitable for students
cons: Lots of physical work, heavy lifting, walking, standing, bending may effect your back

title: ‘Ok work, just didn't get many shifts or they would ring because they were short staffed and expect you to drop everything and come in on short notice. Night fill.’
pros: Good people to work with.
cons: Trying to get shifts.

title: ‘Woolworths has an inviting environment that makes you want to come back to work.’
pros:
- positive environment 
- workable with shifts 
- great management
cons: - Nothing that I can think of.

title: ‘An average experience in woolworths.’
pros: Generally the low level staff. Management is generally below par in their roles and are not great with assisting with issues you may have in the work place.
cons: Dealing with management and their unreasonable expectations. Management being immediate, in store managers as well as rules set by higher management who aren't working in stores.

title: ‘Positive but exhausting ’
pros: Pay is reasonable and the team are like a family
cons: Being retail it’s not family friendly for work life balance unless you are willing to do nights and weekends

title: ‘Made me a very determined, fast paced and results driven employee/manager.’
pros: It has the potential to be a really good place to work. I found that it gave me the tools to know how to work hard and know what its to go home after a rewarding fast paced day.
cons: Minimal help as everyone is always so busy and learning on the job without having a full understanding. Not having great support to back you up when your struggling.

title: ‘It was an unfulfilling job.’
pros: Woolworths provides regular employment, but the salary is not great and the work life is average, at best.
cons: Woolworths is a job, but I found job satisfaction to be low. It was monotonous and there are other employment choices that may be more fulfilling. The staff were diverse, but I encountered a lot of poor social skills amongst staff.

title: ‘Okay for a first job but wouldnt want to stay here forever’
pros: Nice crew  decent hours for night fill long-life either 7pm-12am or 7-3am,  not always having to deal with customers.   as a casual don't always have to work when they ask,   special rates working on holidays, discounts at store
cons: Trying to make boss happy while doing work  either their  way or they are unhappy,     on a busy night pretty much get no help when needed but always expect you to help them  but when you need it they ask you to stay back and they expect yes otherwise there always angry with you.

title: ‘I love working at Woolworths.’
pros: Staff discount. Flexibility for shifts. Career development opportunities. They do everything legal (pay, breaks, leave etc). Plenty of support from all areas of management.
cons: Standard rude customers.  Its actually really tiring physically and mentally.

title: ‘Terrible’
pros:
Team work
Meets new people
Discounts and benefits
cons: Fast paced environment

title: ‘Great company to work for’
pros: Flexibility of hours and weekend work. Support from management.
cons: Other staff do not always have the same values and work ethic as you.

title: ‘Great experience, my first job and don’t have anything bad to say about the company that’s treated me so well.’
pros: Very nice people working around me, very flexible too and always had hours available for me.
cons: Some managers can be a little pushy and not let staff work without calling every five minutes.

title: ‘High expectation for low pay and high stress’
pros: Fun being part of a team, got to know co-workers well
cons: Dealing with quotas and annoying management failures

title: ‘It was horrible. So glad I quit.’
pros: Nothing was good about working here
cons: They were horrible staff and gave no one any shifts, just kept employing new people to make more money

title: ‘Only work there as a temporary thin too much hard work        for shop assistants.     even managers    pay is not worth it,    also putting up      with some customers. Would be worth it if paid more’
pros: Permanent rights having a union, secure job
cons: No promo guidance or management program no real opportunity

title: ‘The best thing I ever did at woolworths, was leave’
pros: Excluding management, the employees are typically good people
cons: The work load is outrageous and the expectations cannot be met.

title: ‘Horrible’
pros: Meeting new people
cons: Getting treated equally

title: ‘Learnt a lot but will never go back’
pros: Not many but some people are good
cons: Employees not willing to take on more responsibility to help others

title: ‘Challenging and rewarding yet disappointing’
pros: Staff are easy to get along with.
cons: Customer satisfaction

title: ‘Below average’
pros: Can have flexible hours
cons: Management. Lack of loyalty

title: ‘A great fun and exciting entry into the work force, but hard to maintain a good work/social life balance’
pros:
Lively fun place to work. Great variety of jobs, You can work in different departments.
Great people to work with.
cons: Your hours are all over the place, never consistent. Say goodbye to weekend's. And be prepared to take lots of painkillers.

title: ‘Love my job’
pros: Love the staff I work with
cons: Haven't had any challenges yet.

title: ‘Life long fiends but a challenge’
pros: The friends you make
cons: Working with budget constraints

title: ‘Always encourage customers to come back to woolworths’
pros: Workers are helpful,good team work
cons: Working for public ,like to see that customers are always happy and comes back again

title: ‘Teamwork with a difference’
pros: Good team environment, as long as you are consistent with work and profit is made.
cons: Working after a transfer from a defunct Woolworths owned business. Some fellow workers are peeved I have taken thier hours, which can be tough in our current employment opportunities in Mackay

title: ‘Amazing’
pros: Woolworths is an awesome place to work for with an amazing group of staff.
cons: Hours are not as long as if like

title: ‘Loved working as deli manager. But will quickly pass up bakery.’
pros:
Fair work roster
Good rate of pay
Some fellow colleagues great to work with
cons: Meeting company expectations without the right amount of staff

title: ‘A great employer who will reward hard work and offer security.’
pros: Flexibility And genuine care for employees
cons: Career opportunities

title: ‘Loved working there was there. For 11 years. Very easy to work for. Great career opportunities.’
job_title: Customer Servixe Manager. Sorrier Services Officer
pros: The people. The jobs. The opportunity for advancement. Loves working there.
cons: Sometimes time challenges for tasks.

title: ‘Wouldn't go back’
pros: Get 5% off purchases
cons: Expected to work for free, through breaks. Don't get the support you need. Never enough staff on

title: ‘Forget your work life balance or fair working environment if you work at woolies.’
pros: The work is good once you're in the routine.
cons: Every single staff member has a bad attitude or acts like their in high school still. Managers are generally the worst.

title: ‘Terrible Management and don't care about employees.’
pros: You get to work within a team and get some experience helping customers.
cons: Working in a set period of time.

title: ‘Disappointing and misleading company’
pros: Staff not management
cons: Keeping a job and lack of support from management

title: ‘A place where you can work and be part of a team’
pros: Learning new skills and being part of a team
cons: Reaching goals, achieving tasks in set times

title: ‘Love it here’
pros: The customers
cons: Learning new things

title: ‘Great place to work’
pros: Work environment , Great people to work with. Good training skills provides for staff. Promotions
cons: Sometimes dealing with dufficult customers.

title: ‘Woolworths changes work routines to get better service for their customers.’
pros: Using my knowledge and experience helping customers and other team members with what they want or need.
cons: Optimizing sales and minimal waste..

title: ‘Incredible’
pros: Everyone was so friendly great team work
cons: There wasn't really any it was pretty easy

title: ‘BORING’
pros: The people I worked with were super nice
cons: Bagging groceries for 6+ hours non stop standing in one spot

title: ‘Good company to work for can transfer with stores and states always to move forward if desired’
pros: Moving forward opportunities to develop
cons: Work life balance working in a remote region

title: ‘A large rose with little to no thorns’
pros: A loving and caring environment where you get to know nearly every co worker down to the point
cons: Moving up in the business and seeking contracts

title: ‘Not very rewarding as you cannot achieve everything you are asked to do, you need to work out what you need to do to get through and what you can cut corners with. ’
pros: Good salary If you are prepared to put in the effort
cons: Extremely high expectations, dynamic environment, broad responsibilities.

title: ‘Its been good to me but i want something new’
pros: Friendly people and customers most of the time
cons: Maintaining the standards they want regardless of the severe staffing issues sometimes

title: ‘Stagnant business.’
pros: It is like being a character on Game of Thrones, waiting for the next re-structure and not sure if you will be here next season.
cons: High level guidance is like a compass without a needle.

title: ‘Reasonable’
pros: Co workers
cons: Management and their policy and procedures cycle

title: ‘Good to have regular customers rewarding’
pros: Make good friends
cons: Customer service

title: ‘Its great to work with Woolworths’
pros: The friends I made and the environment around me.
cons: Learning new strategies to make the store a better smooth running work place.

title: ‘From a kid to an over 30 year career. ’
pros:
People, People and People.
Challenging and Rewarding
cons: Balancing life with the retail spread of hours. Can be achieved with the right planning.

title: ‘Great first job, that gave me experience for future employment.’
pros: Large company with a great system in place at all levels
cons: Managers tend to favor on a personal level rather than merit

title: ‘Highs and lows’
pros: The staff are great!
cons: Cut wages and minimum staff but extra jobs.

title: ‘Loved providing customer service, that's it.’
pros: Providing customer service, helping customers
cons: Difficult staff, staff being competitive.

title: ‘Do not recommend. ’
pros: Lots of opportunities for growth of career
cons: A lot of lack sheep who put the bottom line before the health of the employees

title: ‘Great place to work and I felt my work was valued ’
pros: Great place to work with friendly staff.
cons: Getting everything done in time.

title: ‘One of the best first job's you'll get!’
pros: The people you'll work with
cons: Learning everything in the first weeks

title: ‘Terrible’
pros: Have an income and meet some nice customers
cons: Not having a roster befire the next week, getting yelled at for talking to a customer for 2minutes, when working in another department you cant do your job as check out badgers you to serve for them.

title: ‘Made good mates’
pros: Hot a payout after being made redundant after 20 years
cons: Getting under payed for 9years and then been made redundant

title: ‘Couldn't leave quick enough’

title: ‘A great place to start your first job with many opportunities for advancement’

title: ‘Good, excellent opportunities for management roles.’
pros: One of the highest paid retail stores in the country. Good work environment.
cons: Upper Management likes to frequently bring in new initiatives and ideas which may not always have been thought out in the best interests of the staff.

title: ‘A lot of work/pressure for no reward.’
pros: People I work with are good. Good job security if you want to stay there.
cons: The job is so different to what it was 15 years ago. I'm a trades man and we don't do anything that remotely resembles my trade anymore. Decisions are made for you that don't work. The pressure to get the job done without staff is getting out of control. It's no wonder they have lost the top spot to Coles. To make money and sales you have to spend money and invest in the talent they have. When they get that right they will be a more desire able place to work.

title: ‘Great for cutting your management teeth but have a plan to move onwards and upwards.’
pros: Decent salary for the job. No need for a degree to earn good money. Nationally recognised business.
cons: Boring work. Easy to develop a sense of feeling trapped. Poor decisions made by executives affects everyone. Too many changes to management structure.

title: ‘Woolworths is a stressful but good environment to be working in.’

title: ‘Over worked and under paid’
pros: The staff
cons: Getting the job done

cons: Work life balance, focused on task not the customer and team

title: ‘Great place to work’

title: ‘Ok place to work’

cons: Saving wages which means cutting hours

title: ‘Anxious’

title: ‘Decent place to work but needs to work on work life balance’

title: ‘Discriminating and rubbish’
pros: I get to work with Customers
cons: Challenging just to get acknowledgement from the store manager. I am a married mum of 3 and on my application my hours of availability were clearly stated , I got an interview, got offered a position at Woolworths Mountain Creek, and then after my first shift had to fight tooth and nail just to get hours. I didn't get 1 shift over the xmas new year period (the most busiest time of year for a supermarket) and from my 1st shift I then waited 9 weeks for another which was on a 4 hour shift. I have not worked a singe shift since feb and it is now oct and as of the 7 of November I have been employed with them for 1 year.  I think it is discriminating and disgusting the way I have been treated all because I have 3 children and cannot work early morning or late night shifts.  but yet they still gave me a job.

title: ‘Average’

title: ‘It started as a great experience but it got stressful and frustrating in time.’
pros: Woolworths is still a solid company to work for. It's a big name on the market and works well for your resume. Unfortunately due to some debatable strategic decision it has been facing several challenges in the past year or so that caused a lot of disconnection between the department and frustration. That's the reason behind the low scoring.
cons: Disconnection between the department and changing the status quo are the biggest challenges these days. The business is not taking advantage of its size and presence in the market but is instead threatened by the low leadership quality and the absence of speed to market.
location: Bella Vista, New South Wales, Australia

title: ‘I love my job.’

*If you are over 18 years of age, you won't be allocated many shifts because you cost the company too much money.
*Working hard does not change this situation.
*You have to pay for your own uniform.

title: ‘Don't do it to yourself and apply for a job here, even if your desperate’
pros: There aren't many, I suppose the prospect of being paid at the end of the week!! And really, the people you work with as far as other staff are concerned.
cons: Dealing with management that should never have been given the responsibility of looking after employees. Several managers I worked under had very poor people skills, and most, except for a couple of floor managers and the Nightfill Supervisor, had any empathy towards the people they were responsible for. And when people have been injured whilst working for them, the Gestapo like manner they go about helping the worker get back to their duties, and the arrogance some management exhibit during your work day/night.

Management support is non existent unless you are in the \"click\"  and also lowers staff morale.  All in all it is a challenge to get up daily and drive the 1.5 hours to work.  Problem is alot of roles are so defined you are really locked into that role.

title: ‘Great environment, high expectations.’

title: ‘A decent experience in the Retail area.’

title: ‘Had it's ups and downs’

title: ‘Glad I'm not there anymore.’

cons:
Cliques. 
Load of work generally falls onto the one or two people not in cliques especially on a night shift. 
Not a great job if you have school aged children as you must work a weekend shift. 
They aren't flexible if you have a family yet expect you to be 100% flexible for them.

title: ‘Ok first job.’
pros: Started in a small town woolies. The line manger was amazing. Great culture for high schooler.
cons: Higher management and other management were not easy to deal with for high school students. Very rude, did not listen to staff.

title: ‘Just a wonderful working enviroment’

Ridiculous hours, up to 60-70 on an average week.
Cares about customers and profits but not at all about the team

cons: Department and store management, budgets, expectations vs realities, fortnightly pay.

title: ‘Friendly environment good payment ’

title: ‘Good people get promoted. Poor ones stagnate.’
pros: Good store team at times.
cons:
Often management seems inexperienced in planning and very removed from the concerns of the other staff. This creates a competitive atmosphere between the staff and management which would be beneficial if it wasn't always present.
The current climate is that hours are being cut all the time, and there is too much work going around for not enough people, leading in some cases to a feeling of hopelessness among the staff.

title: ‘There is alot of politics with this business, especially within Operations’

title: ‘I have never felt so alienated and under appreciated. I felt like nobody ever noticed I was there.’

Trying to form any kind of relationship with colleagues.

The work environment.

Communication between management/supervisors and casual staff.

Inclusion

Understanding and general respect

title: ‘Terribly overworked for little to no reward.’
pros: Woolworths doesn't care about ethnic origins when hiring staff and offers equal chance of employment and promotion based on merit.
cons: Supermarkets are a terrible place to work where no decisions made on how to run the store are actually made at ground zero rather they're made in the eastern states and instructed via countless emails and work instructions. There is no such thing as a work life balance as you're expected to complete the work of 3 staff members in your one shift due to \"changes\" in procedures designed to make the task easier therefore requiring less hours to complete, to top it off when you work extra hours to complete said tasks as you're constantly judged and penalised on your inability to complete tasks given in what they (people whom have never even completed the task before themselves) deem necessary they \"performance manage\" you for having a poor work life balance. Senior leadership in Woolworths are so terrible they have no direction changing their plans often several times a month making it incredibly hard to achieve anything, this has obviously been reflected in the share price as it has halved in the last 5yrs.

cons: Call ups are very frequent and although you are not obliged to work outside your normal hours, call ups are so frequent you end up only showing up to one in five maybe call ups. This could potentially affect your 'status' within the company. This can also make your shift more demanding when collegues do not show up.

title: ‘Stressful and mentally degrading work environment. ’
pros: The people at Woolies are generally decent to work with as long as you’re a team member, not a supervisor.
cons: It’s constantly understaffed, and the customers are verbally aggressive. There’s no respect for boundaries or a healthy work environment.

title: ‘Don't expect management to care.’
pros: Working with other people at your level, who has the same idea about upper management and the huge pay gaps.
cons: Getting things done in a time frame which makes it near impossible, because of the under starting issues.

title: ‘Enjoyable, easy. ’
pros: Flexibility. Large support
cons: A lot of gossip and workplace drama

title: ‘I question if the salary is worth it’
pros: We are paid extremely well for our annual salary plus our super scheme for salaried employees is one of the best out there in my opinion.
cons: The expectations they put on salaried people is extremely challenging. We used to work incredibly long hours to get most things done - now we get in trouble for doing too many hours, or we don’t get the jobs done and get in trouble for that. The pressure for management is getting harder.

title: ‘Got to diversify and hang in there’
pros: Good pay for essentially unskilled labour. Work indoors, different depts so you can break the boredom. Most team are hard workers and get along.
cons: Culture of using casuals and then cutting hours with little notice. Hard for anyone over 45 to get contracts. Management are self absorbed and want numbers to look good despite what they say about customer service.

title: ‘Love the environment  and my co workers ’
pros: Workmates.  flexble
cons: Everything was so simple

title: ‘You are just a number’
pros: The other people you work with make or break the job
cons: Poor attitude from management providing for a toxic working environment.

title: ‘A great place to work’
pros: The team work and ability to handle tasks
cons: Learning the pos systems can take time but it’s easy to get the Hang of after a few weeks

title: ‘I am happy that I got the opportunity to work at Woolworths, however, I wish that the company was more connected to their staff (especially casuals).’
pros: Great opportunities and a wide range of skills taught.
cons: Pay and the lack of communication.

title: ‘10 years of hell ’
pros: Co workers become friends
cons: Management changes too often and are often rude and untrained and on power trips

cons: Very tiring on my back and very tedious  when on registers.

pros: Pay for retail is good

title: ‘It's okay, but not the best’
pros: As a casual employee, you are given a bit of flexibility with your shifts as long as there is a genuine reason. It fits around schooling quite well due to this.
cons: As an older casual employee it is a struggle to get shifts, I have asked to go part-time, but nothing has been done. Also as a casual one must provide a doctors note for being sick, which we've never had to do before. Management is also very difficult, everything needs to be perfect and they just don't understand what it is like to be working on the floor

title: ‘No where near enough staff and has a high work cover related injury records resulting in job losses.’
pros: Most staff are excellent and get along well, hard working and care for their customers.
cons: Not enough store wage budget to cope with consumer demand. Small wage budget = less staff and higher gross profit. Be prepared to do the work of 2 or 3 people.

title: ‘Enjoyed the diversity, and further expanded my knowledge in a different sector of the retail industry.’
pros: New friends made, great hours, and extra hours were offered. Teamwork and good training given.
cons: Lack of enthusiasm from the younger generation. Other than that I enjoyed doing my job, had got an award in the short time I was there, and many great comments on my displays and freshness in my seafood dept, from visiting store managers.
